episodes.title: 10 Countries That Label Scientology as a Dangerous Cult 🌍⚠️
episodes.description:
👉SUBSCRIBE : https://bit.ly/3Z5de2S 
Scientology claims to be a religion, but in many countries it is officially regarded as a dangerous cult. From Europe to Latin America, governments have rejected its recognition, prosecuted its leaders, and warned citizens about its practices.
In this video, we break down the ten countries that classify Scientology as a dangerous cult and explain the reasons behind their decisions—from fraud convictions in France to surveillance in Germany and outright bans in Russia.
All of the information in this video is based on official reports, court rulings, and investigative journalism. You can find the complete list of sources in the description below 👇
📚 Sources
Wikipedia – Scientology in France: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientology_in_France
Wikipedia – Scientology status by country: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientology_status_by_country
MIVILUDES (France) – Official reports on cults: https://www.derives-sectes.gouv.fr
German Office for the Protection of the Constitution – Reports on Scientology (Verfassungsschutz): https://www.verfassungsschutz.de
Belgian judiciary press releases on Scientology trials: https://www.justitie.belgium.be
Swiss Federal Court rulings (cases involving Scientology): https://www.bger.ch
Russian court rulings banning Scientology texts: https://www.sova-center.ru
Israeli parliamentary commission on cults (1987): https://www.knesset.gov.il
Reports on Scientology in Norway, Argentina, Poland, and Hungary (news and watchdog coverage): https://www.hrw.org

episodes.title: 5 countries that have banned Jehovah’s Witnesses
episodes.description:
👉SUBSCRIBE : https://bit.ly/3Z5de2S 
In this video, we explore five countries that have banned Jehovah’s Witnesses and investigate why governments have taken such drastic measures against this religious group. From Russia’s declaration of “extremism” to Singapore’s strict national service laws, Tajikistan’s legal crackdown, Eritrea’s harsh repression, and Turkmenistan’s refusal to recognize them, we reveal the political, cultural, and legal reasons behind these bans.
Jehovah’s Witnesses are known worldwide for their door-to-door ministry, neutrality in politics, and refusal of military service. But in these countries, those same beliefs have led to imprisonment, loss of rights, and the complete outlawing of their communities.
This documentary-style video provides historical background, real cases of persecution, and the broader implications for freedom of religion and human rights. Whether you are studying world religions, human rights, or international politics, this video will give you a clear, factual overview of how and why Jehovah’s Witnesses face bans in certain nations.
Don’t forget to like, share, and subscribe for more deep dives into global issues, faith, and freedom.
📖 Sources:
Human Rights Watch – https://www.hrw.org
USCIRF – United States Commission on International Religious Freedom – https://www.uscirf.gov
Wikipedia – Persecution of Jehovah’s Witnesses – https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persecution_of_Jehovah%27s_Witnesses
HRWF – Human Rights Without Frontiers – https://hrwf.eu
United Nations Human Rights Committee – https://www.ohchr.org
